rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--TRT

classVariables.definition: The reported name of the drug, procedure, or therapy.
classVariables.label: Name of Treatment
classVariables.name: --TRT
classVariables.notes: The topic for the intervention observation, usually the verbatim name of the treatment, drug, medicine, or therapy given during the dosing interval for the observation.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--MODIFY

classVariables.definition: A value which represents an alteration to a collected value for coding purposes.
classVariables.label: Modified Treatment Name
classVariables.name: --MODIFY
classVariables.notes: If the value for --TRT is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DECOD

classVariables.definition: Standardized or dictionary-derived text for the description of an event or intervention.
classVariables.label: Standardized Treatment Name
classVariables.name: --DECOD
classVariables.notes: Equivalent to the generic drug name in WHODrug, or a term in SNOMED, ICD-9, or other published or sponsor-defined dictionaries.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--MOOD

classVariables.definition: The state that may be applied to a record to indicate its phase in a life cycle or business process (e.g., scheduled, performed).
classVariables.label: Mood
classVariables.name: --MOOD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--CAT

classVariables.definition: A grouping or classification of the topic of the finding, event, or intervention.
classVariables.label: Category
classVariables.name: --CAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--SCAT

classVariables.definition: A further grouping or classification of the category for the topic of the finding, event, or intervention.
classVariables.label: Subcategory
classVariables.name: --SCAT
classVariables.notes: The category is in --CAT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--PRESP

classVariables.definition: An indication that the event or intervention was prospectively stated or detailed on the CRF.
classVariables.label: Pre-Specified
classVariables.name: --PRESP
classVariables.notes: Values should be "Y" or null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--OCCUR

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether a prespecified event or intervention has occurred.
classVariables.label: Occurrence Indicator
classVariables.name: --OCCUR

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--REASOC

classVariables.label: Reason for Occur Value
classVariables.name: --REASOC
classVariables.notes: --REASOC is the reason the intervention did or did not occur, according to the value in --OCCUR. This does not replace --INDC.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--STAT

classVariables.label: Completion Status
classVariables.name: --STAT
classVariables.notes: Used to indicate when a question about the occurrence of a prespecified intervention was not answered. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--REASND

classVariables.definition: The explanation for why requested information was not available.
classVariables.label: Reason Not Done
classVariables.name: --REASND
classVariables.notes: Used in conjunction with --STAT when value is "NOT DONE".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--CNTMOD

classVariables.label: Contact Mode
classVariables.name: --CNTMOD
classVariables.notes: The way in which the event, visit, or contact was conducted.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--EPCHGI

classVariables.label: Epi/Pandemic Related Change Indicator
classVariables.name: --EPCHGI
classVariables.notes: Indicates whether the intervention was changed due to an epidemic or pandemic.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--INDC

classVariables.definition: The sign, symptom, or condition that is the basis for initiation of a treatment.
classVariables.label: Indication
classVariables.name: --INDC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--CLAS

classVariables.definition: A standardized or dictionary-derived name for a grouping of drugs, procedures, or therapies.
classVariables.label: Class
classVariables.name: --CLAS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--CLASCD

classVariables.definition: A standardized or dictionary-derived short sequence of characters used to represent a grouping of drugs, procedures, or therapies.
classVariables.label: Class Code
classVariables.name: --CLASCD
classVariables.notes: Used to represent code for --CLAS.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSE

classVariables.definition: The quantity of an agent (e.g., drug, substance, radiation) taken or absorbed at a single administration.
classVariables.label: Dose
classVariables.name: --DOSE
classVariables.notes: Not populated when --DOSTXT is populated.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSTXT

classVariables.definition: A textual description of the quantity of an agent (e.g., drug, substance, radiation) taken or absorbed at a single administration.
classVariables.label: Dose Description
classVariables.name: --DOSTXT
classVariables.notes: Not populated when --DOSE is populated.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSU

classVariables.definition: The unit of measure for the administered agent (e.g., drug, substance, radiation), using standardized values.
classVariables.label: Dose Units
classVariables.name: --DOSU
classVariables.notes: Units for --DOSE, --DOSTOT, or --DOSTXT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--TDOSD

classVariables.label: Toxic/Physiologic Dose Descr
classVariables.name: --TDOSD
classVariables.notes: A description of a statistically derived estimate of a dose with a certain toxicological or physiological effect in a population, based on data from a dose-response study.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--FTDOSD

classVariables.examples: If --TDOSD="LD50" and --FTDOSD="5", then the value represented by --DOSE and --DOSU is 5 times the LD50.
classVariables.label: Factor for Toxic/Physiologic Dose Descr
classVariables.name: --FTDOSD
classVariables.notes: The quantity given for the multiplier of --TDOSD.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSFRM

classVariables.definition: Physical characteristics of a drug product, (e.g., tablet, capsule, or solution) that contains a drug substance, generally (but not necessarily) in association with one or more other ingredients.
classVariables.label: Dose Form
classVariables.name: --DOSFRM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSFRQ

classVariables.definition: The number of times that an agent (e.g., drug, substance, radiation) is administered per unit of time.
classVariables.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
classVariables.name: --DOSFRQ

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSTOT

classVariables.definition: The quantity of an agent (e.g., drug, substance, radiation) taken or absorbed on a single day.
classVariables.label: Total Daily Dose
classVariables.name: --DOSTOT
classVariables.notes: Uses the units in --DOSU.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DOSRGM

classVariables.definition: The planned schedule for the administration of an agent (e.g., drug, substance, radiation).
classVariables.label: Intended Dose Regimen
classVariables.name: --DOSRGM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--ROUTE

classVariables.definition: Designation of the part of the body through which or into which, or the way in which, a substance is introduced.
classVariables.label: Route of Administration
classVariables.name: --ROUTE

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--LOT

classVariables.definition: An identifier assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product.
classVariables.label: Lot Number
classVariables.name: --LOT
classVariables.notes: Although the identifier for a lot is generally called a lot number, it may contain characters other than digits (e.g., letters).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--LOC

classVariables.label: Location of Administration
classVariables.name: --LOC
classVariables.notes: Anatomical location of an intervention, such as an injection site.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--METHOD

classVariables.definition: Method of administration of the treatment.
classVariables.label: Method of Administration
classVariables.name: --METHOD
classVariables.usageRestrictions: Not in human clinical trials; EX domain only

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--LAT

classVariables.label: Laterality
classVariables.name: --LAT
classVariables.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing laterality of intervention administration.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--DIR

classVariables.label: Directionality
classVariables.name: --DIR
classVariables.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing directionality of intervention administration.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--PORTOT

classVariables.label: Portion or Totality
classVariables.name: --PORTOT
classVariables.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of or apportioning of the intervention administration.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--FAST

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether a subject has abstained from food and liquid for a prescribed amount of time.
classVariables.label: Fasting Status
classVariables.name: --FAST
classVariables.notes: Valid values include "Y", "N", "U", or null if not relevant.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--PSTRG

classVariables.definition: The amount of active ingredient per unit of pharmaceutical dosage form.
classVariables.label: Pharmaceutical Strength
classVariables.name: --PSTRG

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--PSTRGU

classVariables.definition: The unit of measure for the amount of active ingredient per unit of pharmaceutical dosage form, using standardized values.
classVariables.label: Pharmaceutical Strength Units
classVariables.name: --PSTRGU
classVariables.notes: Unit for --PSTRG.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--TRTV

classVariables.definition: A carrier or inert medium in which a medicinally active agent is administered.
classVariables.label: Treatment Vehicle
classVariables.name: --TRTV

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--VAMT

classVariables.definition: Amount of the prepared product (treatment plus vehicle) administered.
classVariables.label: Treatment Vehicle Amount
classVariables.name: --VAMT
classVariables.notes: Note: Should not be diluent amount alone.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--VAMTU

classVariables.definition: The unit of measure for the prepared product (treatment plus vehicle) using standardized values.
classVariables.label: Treatment Vehicle Amount Units
classVariables.name: --VAMTU

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--ADJ

classVariables.definition: The explanation given for why a dose was changed as compared to a previous dose.
classVariables.label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
classVariables.name: --ADJ

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--RSDISC

classVariables.label: Reason for Treatment Discontinuation
classVariables.name: --RSDISC
classVariables.notes: Reason the treatment was discontinued.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--USCHFL

classVariables.definition: An indication that the performed test or observation was done at a time that was not planned.
classVariables.label: Unscheduled Flag
classVariables.name: --USCHFL
classVariables.notes: If a test or observation was performed based upon a schedule defined in the protocol, this flag should be null. Expected values are "Y" or null. This variable would not be needed when information on planned assessments is provided, such as when the Trial Visits (TV) and Subject Visits (SV) domains are used.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--RSTIND

classVariables.label: Restraint Indicator
classVariables.name: --RSTIND
classVariables.notes: An indicator as to whether the animal subject was restrained during the intervention period. Expected values are "Y" or null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Interventions.--RSTMOD

classVariables.label: Restraint Mode
classVariables.name: --RSTMOD
classVariables.notes: A description of whether the restraint was physical and/or chemical.

description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, INTERVENTIONS, 2021-09-24)
label: Interventions
name: Interventions
